Description: Foot sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery kylix; foot in two degrees; fine orange clay, glazed black on top, underside and lower degree of foot; scraped groove on top; reserved: upper degree of foot, resting surface and centre of underside; inscription cut on underside; bore hole for analysis.
Curator's comments: Clay analysed by M. Hughes and found to be Attic: G. Harbottle, M.J. Hughes and S. Seleem, 'The origin of black-figure Greek ceramics found in Naucratis (Nile Delta)', Archaeometry 47 (2005), 511-518; p. 513, table 1, no.21
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 499)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1486)
